meanings.definition: The act of refusing to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her refusal to eat vegetables made her parents worried about her health.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's refusal to postpone the exam upset the students.
meanings.sent3: His refusal to wear a jacket in the snow was both brave and foolish.
meanings.sent4: The refusal of the stubborn old tree to shed its leaves in autumn puzzled the gardener.
meanings.sent5: The refusal of the computer to turn on left him feeling frustrated and helpless.

meanings.definition: The denial of a request or offer.
meanings.sent1: The company's refusal to give a refund angered the customer.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't believe his refusal to accompany her to the party.
meanings.sent3: The refusal of the cat to eat anything but tuna was becoming a daily struggle.
meanings.sent4: The refusal of the storm to let up kept everyone indoors for days.
meanings.sent5: The refusal of the lock to open delayed their plans significantly.
